algorithm.name: TESSERACTOCR
algorithm.description: This component applies Tesseract optical character recognition to an image.

properties.name: FEED_FORWARD_TYPE
properties.description: Applies to images and videos. The type of feed-forward behavior. Controls how this algorithm will make use of the tracks generated in the previous pipeline stage. If this algorithm is used in the first pipeline stage then this property has no effect. Instead, the default segmenting behavior is used, where tracks from the previous stage are used to generate segments based on the TARGET_SEGMENT_LENGTH and MIN_SEGMENT_LENGTH properties. Can be set to “NONE”, “FRAME”, or “SUPERSET_REGION”. If set to “NONE”, the default segmenting behavior is used. If set to “FRAME” or “SUPERSET_REGION”, then the segment length properties are ignored and instead this algorithm will process one segment per track generated in the previous stage. If set to “FRAME”, then this algorithm will ignore the regions associated with previous detections and instead process the entire frame associated with each of those detections. If set to “SUPERSET_REGION”, then this algorithm will generate a superset region for each of the previous tracks – a bounding box of constant size and position that encloses all of the track’s detection regions. This algorithm will only process the data within the superset region.

properties.name: FEED_FORWARD_TOP_CONFIDENCE_COUNT
properties.description: Only applies if FEED_FORWARD_TYPE is set to a value other than “NONE”. If set to a value <= 0, then for each track generated in the previous pipeline stage, this algorithm will process the frame associated with each detection in that track, ignoring frames that don’t have detections. If FEED_FORWARD_TYPE is set to “FRAME”, then the entire frame is processed. If FEED_FORWARD_TYPE is set to “SUPERSET_REGION”, then only the superset region for those frames is processed. If this property is set to “1” then only the exemplar frame for each of the previous tracks is processed. If this property is set to a value > 1, say 5, then each of the detections in the previous track are sorted by confidence and this algorithm will only process the frames associated with the top 5 detections with the highest confidence. For detections with the same confidence values, it will select those with a lower frame index. If the track contains less than 5 detections, then all of the available detections are used. In practice, setting this property to a value > 1 has no effect on image and audio jobs because each track only contains one detection.

properties.name: USE_KEY_FRAMES
properties.description: When true the component will only look at key frames (I-frames) from the input video. Can be used in conjunction with FRAME_INTERVAL. For example, when USE_KEY_FRAMES is true, and FRAME_INTERVAL is set to "2", then every other key frame will be processed.

properties.name: FRAME_INTERVAL
properties.description: Controls whether the component performs detection on every frame in the video segment, or skips some frames at a regular interval. Must be greater than or equal to 0. If the frame_interval is set to 0 or 1, a frame_interval of 1 will be used, so that detections are performed on every frame. For a frame interval N > 1, every N-1 frames will be skipped. Default value is defined by the MPF properties file.

properties.name: CONFIDENCE_THRESHOLD
properties.description: The minimum confidence score which must be met or exceeded. Detections below this threshold are silently discarded.

properties.name: STREAMING_ACTIVITY_CONFIDENCE_THRESHOLD
properties.description: The minimum detection confidence score for reporting activity in a frame. Detections with confidence below this value will not cause activity to be reported, but they may become part of a track that is eventually reported at the end of a segment.

properties.name: MIN_GAP_BETWEEN_SEGMENTS
properties.description: In the context of videos, the minimum number of frames between segments which are not adjacent. Value must be greater than or equal to 1. Default value is defined by the MPF properties file.

properties.name: TARGET_SEGMENT_LENGTH
properties.description: In the context of videos, the preferred length of segments which are to be processed by this algorithm. Value is expected to be greater than 10. Default value is defined by the MPF properties file.

properties.name: MIN_SEGMENT_LENGTH
properties.description: In the context of videos, the minimum length of a segment which will be processed by this algorithm. Value must be greater than 0. Default value is defined by the MPF properties file.

properties.name: MERGE_TRACKS
properties.description: In the context of videos, when set to true, attempt to merge tracks spanning segment boundaries. Default value is defined by the MPF properties file.

properties.name: MIN_GAP_BETWEEN_TRACKS
properties.description: In the context of videos, similar tracks with less than this number of frames between them will be merged into a single track. If MERGE_TRACKS is false, this has no effect. Default value is defined by the MPF properties file.

properties.name: MIN_TRACK_LENGTH
properties.description: In the context of videos, defines the minimum track length in frames. Tracks shorter than this minimum length will be silently discarded. Default value is defined by the MPF properties file.

properties.name: MIN_OVERLAP
properties.description: In the context of videos, the minimum overlap between detection bounding boxes for adjacent tracks to be considered continuous. Value is expected to be between 0 and 1. Default value is defined by the MPF properties file.

properties.name: TAGGING_FILE
properties.description: Name of a JSON file (in the plugin's config folder) that describes a tag hierarchy to be used on the full text returned from Tesseract OCR.

properties.name: TESSERACT_LANGUAGE
properties.description: The language OCR will be done in.

properties.name: TESSERACT_PSM
properties.description: Tesseract Page Segmentation Mode. Refer to Tesseract docs for details

properties.name: SEARCH_REGION_ENABLE_DETECTION
properties.description: Enable cropping.

properties.name: SEARCH_REGION_TOP_LEFT_X_DETECTION
properties.description: X coordinate for top left corner of cropped frame. If negative, 0 will be used.

properties.name: SEARCH_REGION_TOP_LEFT_Y_DETECTION
properties.description: Y coordinate for top left corner of cropped frame. If negative, 0 will be used.

properties.name: SEARCH_REGION_BOTTOM_RIGHT_X_DETECTION
properties.description: X coordinate for bottom right corner of cropped frame. If negative, bottom right X of input media will be used.

properties.name: SEARCH_REGION_BOTTOM_RIGHT_Y_DETECTION
properties.description: Y coordinate for bottom right corner of cropped frame. If negative, bottom right Y of input media. will be used.

properties.name: ROTATION
properties.description: Specifies the number of degrees in the clockwise direction that the media will be rotated. Only 90, 180 and 270 degrees are supported.

properties.name: HORIZONTAL_FLIP
properties.description: Specifies whether or not the original media is flipped. Rotation occurs before flipping.

properties.name: AUTO_ROTATE
properties.description: Specifies whether not to rotate media based on EXIF data.

properties.name: AUTO_FLIP
properties.description: Specifies whether or not to flip media based on EXIF data.

properties.name: SHARPEN
properties.description: Weight of the sharpening paremeter. Default is 1.0, 0.0 = original image, higher = sharper

properties.name: SCALE
properties.description: Image rescaling factor. 1.0 = original image size, any value greater than 1.0 increases input size. Default optimal rescaling set to 2.4.

properties.name: THRS_FILTER
properties.description: Toggles filtering of OCR results by character frequencies (vowels, punctuation, etc.). Effective for shorter sequences of strings.

properties.name: HIST_FILTER
properties.description: Toggles filtering of OCR results by histogram correlation to english character frequencies. Needs longer sequences of words to be effective.

properties.name: NUM_ONLY
properties.description: Specifies whether to allow OCR detections that include only numbers.

properties.name: MIN_WORD_LEN
properties.description: Specifies minimum word length required for a detection. Default value 3 = reject any output where all words are less than 3 characters in length.

properties.name: MIN_HIST_SIZE
properties.description: Specifies minimum number of english characters needed for a histogram comparison. Strings with less than specified number will only go through threshold check to avoid false negatives.

properties.name: MIN_HIST_SCORE
properties.description: Specifies minimum threshold comparison score (0-1.0). Higher values result in less detections.

properties.name: MAX_ENG_PNCT
properties.description: Specifies max fraction of english punctuation in a detection. Default value .35 = any detection with >35% punctuation characters would be removed. Ignores whitespace.

properties.name: MAX_FRN_CHAR
properties.description: Specifies max fraction of non-english characters in a detection.

properties.name: VOWEL_MIN
properties.description: Specifies min fraction of english vowels in a detection

properties.name: VOWEL_MAX
properties.description: Specifies max fraction of english vowels in a detection

actions.name: TESSERACT OCR ACTION
actions.description: OCR action with auto rotate, flip, and PSM1.
